website_summaries.verdict: Write and transfer speeds allow capture of clear 1080p video. Durable option for recording in rugged environments.
pros: both shockproof and waterproof, and won't be damaged by airport security equipment
Compatible with most modern digital and action cameras
80 Mbps transfer speed compares favorably with most other SD memory cards
cons: May lag or buffer when recording 4K video

customer_reviews.title: Sad day! Lost over 400 pictures.
customer_reviews.text: Will not buy again! Just got done with a photo shoot and went to load pictures onto my computer and they are not there. I viewed them on my camera and could see them. Put card into computer and they are not there. But back into camera and says “Cannot Playback image” this is only my second time using this card.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Corrupt within 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these cards and within two weeks they were both corrupt and unreadable by my computer. I lost over 1000 photos. SanDisk informed me that they don't offer file recovery or reimbursement due to problems with their cards. Completely unhelpful. They DO NOT stand behind their product. Look elsewhere for a reliable card if you value your photos and data. Two weeks was too short to loose everything. Luckily Amazon has great customer service and refunded me.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Memory Card! Excellent Amount of Space!
customer_reviews.text: This SanDisk 64GB memory card is awesome! Just barely bought a new Canon camera and didn't have a memory card, so decided to go with this one because of the amount of space for the low price! Definitely what I was looking for. This memory card holds a ton of pictures - that can be taken in super high quality, plus holds a lot of highly quality videos as well. Great speeds, excellent write-ability. When I want to take the pictures/videos off of the memory card, I just plug it into the computer/laptop and I am able to remove the files super easily. Highly recommend this memory card!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Hier

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible!!!!!! Bought this for special video shooting. Came back home to find no files on card although camera recorded.. At home recorded a few seconds just to verify... card recorded new files and counter advanced. All in all, 58 missing files from my special fotoshoot!!! Now retrieving some of the footage via recovery program. Very partial footage is recovered. Lost project!!!!!!!! Unreliable!!!!
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: 128 gb is Defect, memory card is full
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for Nikon D3000 Camera and it was defected. When i put it in the camera, it asked me to format it. After formatting, it said the memory card is full. Called Amazon and they offer to send me another which had similar problem. I had ordered another memory card from this company called "SanDisk Extreme Pro 32gb" and it worked fine. I dont know if has anything to do with the space or this product is defected.
customer_reviews.author: RabJani

customer_reviews.title: Not detecting on Computer !!
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be trustworthy to buy directly from Amazon (as non-third party supplier) and after use for my next photoshoot last week. It was working on camera and last night I had the hard time to detect this card on my Mac for editing. It does not detect in my Mac book anymore. However, I went to apple to check my ports having problem and Apple store confirmed that it is working. It seems card become corrupt and I am not able to recover my photos from last week shoot. First Disappointment direct from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amit

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 cards in January and just now tried one in my cameras, of which I plan to use on my vacation to Europe. It does not work in either! I did some reading on this from Sandisk and found out that it may not be compatible with older systems. So, I reviewed the ad on Amazon and nowhere does it makes this statement, but does say that SDXC is compatible with SDHC cards. So, I thought I have one I will return in the original package and cut my loss in half. Guess what? The return policy had expired.So, here I sit with 2 cards worth approximately $50 I can't use. Thanks Amazon. Long time customer
customer_reviews.author: Pennbj

customer_reviews.title: Would NOT work in my camera!!
customer_reviews.text: I was going on a trip and ordered three of these SD cards. I have an older camera in PERFECT condition that works great! But these SD cards would NOT work in my camera. I am MAD because I spent the money on these SD cards and there is no way I'll get it back. I'm not going to buy a new camera just to use these SD cards! I'll keep using my old camera with the old PNY SD cards. I have no idea if these SD cards are good or bad, as I never got to use them in my camera. So it's up to you if you want to buy them. That's my review.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great card for 1080P video recording
customer_reviews.text: This card has been plenty fast for full 1080P video from my Cannon HR600R camera. I have used it constantly for making YouTube videos and it works great and have been 100% reliable.
customer_reviews.author: FrugalPrepper's Garage and Garden

customer_reviews.title: Great value SD card
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying SanDisk brand of memory cards for years and has been of great price value and make. I also buy Kingston brand for which ever can be of lower price. SanDisk however has a more aggressive selection and reasonably priced. What else can I say about a memory card? It works...ok maybe adding the fact that when you want a decent quality SD card, make sure you have a good rating to support both taking pictures and video recording.
customer_reviews.author: Prissy

customer_reviews.title: Reliable card for photo shooting
customer_reviews.text: We got this card to be used in our new DSLR camera.We went out to shoot and the card worked great, no issues whatsoever. We shot in RAW and saw no issues with speed or response when saving and playing back the photos taken. We did not try video this time. I will update my review when we try video, since this card is supposed to be slow for video purposes (recommended for video is 95MB/s or above and SDXC II). When using the card on our computer to backup images, the transfer speeds were good and we had no issues either. I'll update later on to comment on durability.
customer_reviews.author: Rummy

customer_reviews.title: It holds data!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say about the SanDisk 32GB SD card? It IS in fact, a SD card! It holds my data just wonderfully AND it fits in the SD slot of the trail camera I purchased it for. Seriously though, SanDisk is one of the best for the price. I've been using it in a trail camera since about February. I've had it outside (in the camera) in sub-zero temps and up into the 80's (F) without a hiccup so far. I've downloaded pics and video, deleted the data from the card and put it out again for probably 20 write/read/delete cycles without a glitch. I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: John E.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THE ULTRA MEMORY CHIP!  Thanks Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I have not yet tried the camera because I also purchased the recommended memory chip. Problem!-I start to read the instruction booklet that came with the camera and one of the first things it states is to NOT use an Ultra or other class 10 type chips! ARGH! Now I have to purchase another chip before I can even test out the camera. I can, at some point use the chip elsewhere I am sure, but I didn't need it. I understand this is an Amazon problem not Moultie's so I hope someone from Amazon reads this and corrects it. I'll give an honest revue of the camera as soon as I am able to purchase the correct chip.
customer_reviews.author: V. Woyak

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for capturing pics on my Wii U
customer_reviews.text: My son kept pausing smash bros on cool screens, zooming in, and calling me to look at what's on the screen. But he couldn't save those pictures, so I bought him this card. We had to format it, using a windows PC, but that wasn't difficult at all. You can just right-click the drive to bring up a menu with the format option on it. And the Wii U recognized it as soon as I turned it on with the memory card in it. Works perfectly, and my son spent an afternoon just trying to create cool pictures with Smash Bros.
customer_reviews.author: D. Campisi

customer_reviews.title: It is just fine for my needs as I am not a sports ...
customer_reviews.text: It is just fine for my needs as I am not a sports shooter or avid bird or extreme wildlife photographer but it is not the fastest SD card out there. I tested it using h2testw.exe, the write speed is about 20 mb/s and the read speed is between 24 to 30 mb/s so the advertised 80mb/s is either a marketing trick or it has been tested on a machine that is beyond my reach (my laptop is fairly new with 8 GB ram, SSD hard drive and so on). Considering the price it is worthwhile to have a few of these around pocket holes of your camera bag.
customer_reviews.author: MamTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Received genuine sandisk memory card. I believe the others who received "not the real" product were from 3rd party sellers. Card reads and writes fast on my Canon 77D. I have not experienced any buffering while using this card.
customer_reviews.author: R. P.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this card to use with Moultrie A-Series Digital Game Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This card was bundled on Amazon as often bought with the Moultrie A-Series Digital Game Camera. I trusted that they would not bundle together what could not be used together, but I was wrong. When I received my order and read the manual, it specifically said NOT to use Ultra cards with the camera. As the cards are not returnable, I am stuck with them and have no use for them. DON'T GET BURNED ON THIS MISLEADING PAIRING.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Plenty fast
customer_reviews.text: When this came up as a daily deal, I debated whether to purchase it or not. I had always bought Sandisk Extreme Pro cards due to their known reliability, and the fact that they had never failed me before (I've got about 30 Extreme Pro cards between CF, SD, and microSD). There were also inconsistent reviews as to whether is the write speed was decent or not. So I pulled the trigger and bought one...hard to beat $18 for 128GB. Anyway, got the card and ran a speed test. Looks like the large file writes are plenty fast, smaller files are slower, but I'm just using this for photography and have large 30~40mg files to write.
customer_reviews.author: Vu B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Wii Retro Gaming system...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my good old Nintendo Wii to use as a Retro Gaming system. Linux speed test show 25MB/s READ and 15MB/s WRITE with a small 10MB sample (see pic), should have better results with larger samples (1000MB). No issues with Wii Homebrew or Retro gaming. Works well with RetroArch 1.76 (MAME2000, NeoGeo), UAE Wii, Frodo, Wii2600 (Stella), Wii7800, WiiColEm, FCE Ultra GX, Snes9x GX, Gnuboy GX, Not64, NintenDONT, Genesis Plus and WiiSX emulation. Loads faster than the standard class 4 SD cards. NOTE: 32GB SD is only compatible with your Wii if you are on firmware version 4.3U. Good deal for under $9 for a very reliable SD card.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works fine, great storage but cheaply built.  the locking tab broke off
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to work with my Sony digital camera. I make YouTube videos. It worked just fine. great external storage device but it is cheaply made. the yellow sliding locking tab broke off and so I've had to use tape to cover the side slot to read and record on it...but this doesn't work all the time. I've had to buy a second one just to prevent myself from going insane with frustration over the randomness of this short term fix. Very disappointed in this product for the money I spent. However the replacement one I bought was only 60% of the price of the first.
customer_reviews.author: Jay from Baltimore

customer_reviews.title: Sandisk quality really can't be beat
customer_reviews.text: I bought this memory card for use with a Leica (V-LUX TYP 114) digital camera. Even though it came ready to use and pre-formatted, I formatted it again 'in camera' to be sure it conformed to what format specs my camera wanted. I normally shoot RAW/JPEG combo images and very rarely some 4K video. The card has worked perfectly every time I have used it. I have tested it by taking pictures, deleting pictures, and reformatting and it still is working perfectly. I don't have any complaints, and at the surprisingly low price, it was a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: B R J

customer_reviews.title: Too good.
customer_reviews.text: I use this as my daily driver for my Nikon D3300. I can hold over 4000 4k resolution photos. I use it mainly to shoot 1080p video. I have not come close to filling it up and download speed from it to my computer are decent. It's actually too big for my needs. I shoot 5 to 20-minute videos for my youTube channel and I hardly ever go over 5 gigabytes. If I had to do it all over, I would have gotten a much smaller one but I won't take off a star since that's my mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best SD Card Brand... Sandisk!
customer_reviews.text: This Sandisk was really good. I have always been a fan of Sandisk, so this card was as expected. I like the blue Sandisks more, but this is okay too. I only transferred pictures and videos and it transferred correctly with no problems. Not as fast as it says it is, but it gave me time to do other things while I waited. There were no downloads, so I do not know how that would have turned out. The memory in this Sandisk is a LOT. I don't even have enough pictures or videos to put into it, but maybe I will when the time comes. I'm happy with this SD card. ^_^
customer_reviews.author: LuckyTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SD CARD!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This SD card was a companion gift with a camera for my son for Christmas. We didn't have any issue with it so far. Just formatted it and he went off taking pictures. The price was good when we bought it, not sure if it has dropped or not. Prices seem to change every couple of minutes here on Amazon. Since this SD is a Class 10 SDHC there shouldn't be any issues with quick transfers and HD video. It's waterproof, temperature-proof, X-ray proof, magnet-proof, and shockproof. So there shouldn't be any fear of loosing the data stored on it. Most importantly it comes with a 10yr warranty!!!
customer_reviews.author: PE

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE !!!  Plastic case is too thick for my Nikon P520
customer_reviews.text: After fighting to get the two cards out of the person proof plastic, I discovered that neither of the two cards will eject from the camera without something to "pry" them out. I have used SanDisk for years and never had this problem. I contacted SanDisk Customer Service and tried to explain the problem with three different "agents" - they stopped the chat when I took too long to gather the info they requested (pictures of card that worked and picture of cards that didn't). One requested the card numbers from the back .. which took a magnifying glass to attempt to read. Over all, a very unsatisfying experience.
customer_reviews.author: G. Enfield

customer_reviews.title: Legit & Authentic Sandisk SD Card! Not a fake/clone!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to expand the memory in my Fire 8” HD Tablet that’s in my 2012 Ram R/T. I put an ATI Procharger (supercharger) on my 5.7 Hemi Ram and I ended up needing a tablet display for engine management to monitor Air/Fuel, Boost, etc. The Fire tablet only had 16gb internal memory, so this 32gb Sandisk SD card was perfect to expand the internal memory and allow the tablet to run smoothly. 100% real and authentic, not a cheap clone/imitation from China. A lot of them floating around on Amazon, this is not one of them. Definitely a real Sandisk card. Bought on Amazon Day for $6. What a steal!!
customer_reviews.author: John Corsner

customer_reviews.text: i tried to update my camera Firmware with the same type SanDisk card (16 GB 80/s) and it completely failed! the camera did not see the .bin file at all. what a royal waste of time to finally realize the card was somehow defective. once i used a new SanDisk 95 MB/s all updates of the .bin file updated perfectly. i can't explain it. i returned the 16 GB card to Best Buy for a refund and returned this 32GB 80/s MB Card to Amazon for a credit!
customer_reviews.author: mbmoto

customer_reviews.title: NOT compatible with Wyze Cam!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go in my Wyze cam. I spend a while researching making sure it was all the right format/gb/file/size etc etc etc. Well, when I got it, and opened it up (now I can't return because seal is broken), I could not figure out how to get it out of the adapter piece - well because you can't. This is a full size SD card that cannot be taken apart to utilize just the SD without adapter. I wish this had been stated clearly before I purchased, bc I have no use for it now. The packaging and web description don't say anything about this compatibility.
customer_reviews.author: Laura McG

customer_reviews.title: Great Card at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as part of a Christmas gift to my wife to go along with her Nikon D5300 DSLR. Without the card, she was not taking pics...so I made sure to read the reviews and based upon my past experience selected this card for her to use. She is new to DSLR photography, so she is just learning. But the write speeds must be good since she has not complained of any noticeable lag time. She has yet to try video capability, so no comment there. Uploading to a hard drive was quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: TightMan

customer_reviews.title: Wonky write protect switch.
customer_reviews.text: It's an SD card, so it does what it says it should. Main thing with this series though is that defects do happen. With the card I have, the write protection switch is too easily switched. I usually have to very carefully insert the card into any given camera several times in order for the write protection switch to not get switched. With some cameras, it's impossible to insert without tripping the switch. Did not have this problem with SanDisk Extreme Pro, which I purchased many years ago and is still doing great.
customer_reviews.author: King

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Canon G9. MEMORY ERROR.
customer_reviews.text: As the title says. This does NOT work with the Canon G9 camera. I tested it with other cameras and it seems to work, but not with my camera, so... one star. Should let people know that this is not compatible with all digital cameras. It fits in the slot but immediately, out of the packaging, says "MEMORY ERROR". It does not allow me to format it either. I did research and found that these may not work with older cameras. I dislike products that make others seem obsolete. My G9 is an amazing camera. This card SHOULD work but it doesn't. Boo.
customer_reviews.author: jbird

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent memory card
customer_reviews.text: I am very unhappy with this memory card. I've been having trouble transferring pictures from my camera to my laptop ever since I installed this card. The card intermittently show images, sometimes images. show up later after the card has been open on my laptop for a while (20 min or days). I thought I lost an entire set of mages recently, I thought I transferred pictures to a folder. I later clipped on the folder to view it and there were no images and I had already erased the images from the card. I thought the pictures were lost for good. Many days later I clicked on the folder one more time and the images were suddenly there.
customer_reviews.author: soomi c derradji

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a couple weeks. Helped us keep an eye on the cat food outside to keep the raccoons away. Then the power jack on the back of the clock got pressed in while trying to hook it up like normal. It's deep inside the clock now and there is no way to get it out. Also won't run on the battery. And the battery is an odd kind that can't be replaced. Save your money and get something higher quality with a regular battery backup.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Noah

customer_reviews.title: Actually works quite well - some tweeks would make it perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have digitized over 40 reels of super-8 and 8mm film so far. Results are very good. The device works and works well. It helps to have some mechanical aptitude as film requires careful placement within and under guide tabs. Also, there is a feature that allows you to move the video frame so that the film image is properly centered in the resulting video and that process sometimes has to be re-done depending on the film. Most of the resulting digital video is at a FAST speed, up to 2x the proper speed and this is something that has to be fixed with a video editor, such as Windows Movie Editor.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Rice

customer_reviews.title: Song storage for Uconnect.
customer_reviews.text: Quick read/write, durable, reliable, it's a SanDisk. Have 35gb of songs/albums on it. Works great with Uconnect, just format to Fat32 before loading it up. These San Disk Ultra's have been my go to for SD and micro SD cards. I use them for our digital cameras, game/trail cameras, mp3 players, and cell phones. I won't buy anything else anymore really.......and yes I have had other brand SD cards but a few went corrupt and I was unable to recover the data. Never had any issues with SanDisk Ultras.
customer_reviews.author: Southeast VA

customer_reviews.title: Read speeds not as fast as labeled
customer_reviews.text: First thing I noticed when I opened the envelope is all the writing on the packaging was Chinese- Not a bad thing in itself, but makes me question it's legitimacy or if it's a fake sandisk product. So I ran a read/write test. Write speed was 12.4 MB/s (not too bad, actually exceeds the advertised write speed), and read speed was 62.5 MB/s (during the test the peak was 62.7 MB/s). So not too bad, but not as advertised- maybe my laptop's memory reader is bottlenecking it. I can't say yet if it is a good drive, I'll update if I get any corruption issues, but I'm a bit apprehensive for now.
customer_reviews.author: Barry E.

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this brand!
customer_reviews.text: SanDisk are always my go-to SD cards when I am in need, I have one in my cell phone and this one was for my Canon DSLR camera that I just got. It was very easy to just pop into my camera and worked great immediately upon inserting it into the camera. These SD cards have never given me any trouble at all and are able to hold pretty much anything. Great card!!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Lindquist

customer_reviews.title: Holds a lot of documents and pictures. Hassle-free storage
customer_reviews.text: I use these (I bought 2) to store documents and photos downloaded from my laptop online backup provider after my laptop fatally died. I'm retired, so don't really need a laptop. I bought a Samsung tabS2 instead (cost). The Tab S2 takes a Micro USB. I downloaded to an external hard drive (which has a full size USB), the copied my docs and pics to these SanDisk cards using a Vinjay (I think that's how you spell it) adapter. Worked great Now my docs and pics are available on my Tab S2. Great delivery
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Works as promised
customer_reviews.text: I use this card in a camcorder. I wanted a class 10 card hoping that it would help with the video resolution.. for some reason when I record in 1080p the image just isn't as crystal clear as I want and hoped a class 10 card would fix the issue. It did not but I now realize this is due to the camcorder itself and not the card. The card does its job, and does it well. No issues with the card, it worked as soon as I plugged it in to the camera and my PC recognizes the card immediately when I take my images off the card. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Aydelotte

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Packaging
customer_reviews.text: I assume the chip will perform well, as all previous SanDisk chips have for me. I felt a need to knock it down 2 stars due to the horrible packaging. Once I was able to extract the hermetically sealed chip from the cardboard display pachage, it was a battle to remove the chip. One corner had "Open" embossed on it but I was not able to open that corner or any other corner. I had to carefully cut the plastic around the chip in order to "free" the chip. I continue to believe that packaging engineers (and not just SanDisk's) are a very sadistic group of people.
customer_reviews.author: Pazeen

customer_reviews.title: WORTH IT!
customer_reviews.text: I researched memory cards & types a bit too much when i ordered this... i'll save you some time, just order this or any Class 10 SDXC Memory Type cards. It reads incredibly fast on my Sony Nex 5N camera. I was able to take thousands of photographs & hundreds of long videos on my honeymoon. This is just one review out of MANY reviews; however, i felt it merited the full five stars!
customer_reviews.author: Derrick

customer_reviews.title: hard to open even with scissors, but perfect product by sandisk as usual
customer_reviews.text: you can not beat a good sandisk product - need I say more .. 128GB at under $20 is about right ( at least when I compare with pny at $15 equivalent in the UK ) .. USA people get ripped off with anything that meets UK/European standards and they pay nothing for junk that wont last long - This product is Sandisk and excellent :) 128GB is a good starting point these days - I use a few of these .. nvidia shield tablet, smmasung glaaxy S5 phone and Moto e5 play phone.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Evans

customer_reviews.title: THE choice for a hacked DSi
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my hacked DSi. I needed something that would max out the space that the DSi is compatible with, and would give the fastest read and write speeds on the device and on my computer when loading up games or music. This card is decently fast for any SD card device, and was less than $7 when I bought it. I can still remember spending 10x that for 1/1000 of the space. Overall, a no-brainer for DSi usage, as it is SDHC, and probably good for anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel LaRoche

customer_reviews.title: Always worked for me (but minor Lock switch issue)
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it in my camera for about a year now and it has always performed well. Perhaps the only negative is the Lock switch slides too easy -- I'll remove the card from my camera, plug it into my computer and copy some pictures, then place it back in my camera, but more than a few times when I turn on the camera it will tell me the card is "Locked" even though I didn't purposely slide the switch myself. No big deal, but a little inconvenient. It should be made with the Lock/Unlock switch a little stiffer so it doesn't slide so easy.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph McConahy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: No SD card is perfect, all brands have a percentage that fail but SanDisk is the best of the bunch. I use two in my Nikon camera shooting one as a backup to the other in case of a card failure which happens all too often during data upload to the computer. The write speed is fast and reliable. The cards hold up well in high or low temps.
customer_reviews.author: Andre E. King

customer_reviews.title: Failure - Permanently Write Protected
customer_reviews.text: I use this SD with my camera daily which I then remove from the camera, insert into a Targus SD reader with a usb male, then insert into my computer usb port to download the images. After about ten applications, the SD card converts to a permanent "Write Protected" mode regardless of the side switch which is in the unlock position for deleting data from the card. This disk cannot be formatted to resolve this issue. I had the same problem with the 32GB same SD card and that's why I purchased 2 more but at 64GB each. Moving onto another company product.
customer_reviews.author: Gary J.

customer_reviews.title: My go-to
customer_reviews.text: I'm a hobby level photographer and these cards are perfect for me. I buy the 16gb cards and use one per an occasion or two. Once I'm done I upload my photos to the cloud, move them onto my computer and then onto an external hard drive. The cards get labeled and stored in a waterproof container and I open a fresh card for the next time I need it. The price allows this luxury and I don't see a compelling reason to switch brands any time soon.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty K.

customer_reviews.title: The usual high quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this card for my new camcorder. I am a photographer and have been using SanDisk cards in my DSLR's for several years, both CH and SD types and they have always performed very well. This is my first foray in video. I just wanted to fool around with it a little so I purchased an inexpensive camcorder and this card. Tested both out yesterday. Both performed nicely. Will use them on my retirement vacation next year to shoot some companion video to go along with the photos I shoot of my trip.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Davis

customer_reviews.title: SanDisk Hasn't Failed Me Yet!
customer_reviews.text: I've been completely satisfied with the performance of previously purchased SanDisk cards (both 16GB and 32GB) so when it came time to order for a new camera, bumping up to a 64GB card was a no-brainer. This camera will be primarily for taking pictures and very little videos, so there should be room for thousands of pictures. These cards have always worked for me in the past, and I have yet to have a problem where a card failed and I had to replace it. Great value solid performance! Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dee ArrTop Contributor: Harry Potter

customer_reviews.title: Zero problems - thousands of images shot
customer_reviews.text: Used in a Canon T3i, I've taken literally thousands of images, formatted the card multiple times a week between events and had zero problems. Records 1080p HD video with no dropouts or stutters or failures. Excellent card, excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Will England

customer_reviews.title: Storage
customer_reviews.text: I always use Sandisk. I like the amount that can fit on this card. I do not erase my cards but keep them as back ups. So, when filled, I purchase a new one. That might seem expensive, but since these cards can hold thousands of photos, I think it's worth it. Back in the day when we used film, you could only get maybe 24 pictures on a roll. Yet, you always had the negatives as back ups. I keep these cards when full instead of erasing. So these are definitely a good value for the money. Go with the higher performance cards, like this one, for higher end cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Reliable as usual
customer_reviews.text: I have used SanDisk products for a very long time. As they say "Back in the day" when they were 512Mb. I have never had any issues with their storage products. In fact, I don't even by the warranty from Amazon for these. They have always been reliable. The main feature I love about this disk is that it has a locking feature to keep you from writing to them when you shouldn't. I am a little disappointed that it did not come with a plastic case like they used to. But as usual they are plug in play no formatting usually required for your device.
customer_reviews.author: Berlon Burch

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Lag Like External Hard Drives!
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for about a week, and it's been great. I use it to store movies, pictures, and music. After a few day/weeks, I move the files to my external disk drives for archival. This memory card is great for having zero lag! External hard drives idle, which creates lag (about 3-4 seconds), on computers when you need to access a file. I use the card in my late 2013 rMBP. I love the extra space in such a small size!! Only complaint, is that it sticks out the side of the notebook, about 2 cm, but it's no big deal. That makes it easier to grab!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Stover

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, Speeds are also as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Some comments infer this car does not transfer at the speeds advertised, I think this is due to the reader and/or the PC and the size of the files being transferred. My Dell Latitude E6430 with a i5-3340M CPU, 16GB RAM and Sata HD using the built in SD slot only managed around 20-25 MB/s I have a new Dell using a Xeon E2276M CPU, 32GB RAM and an 1TB m.2 SSD actually hit 90 MB/s but easily maintained 75-80 MB/s on large files.
customer_reviews.author: CHRIS BONNEY

customer_reviews.title: 16GB stores 3749 photos on 16.4mp camera
customer_reviews.text: 16GBWorks great. Using it in a fujifilm xp120 16.4mp camera. The camera I have displays on screen that this card can store 3749 “normal” quality photos. If I change the settings to the “fine” (highest) photo quality it says it can hold 1188 photos. Not bad for under $10. Write speed allows me to take one photo a second just fine, which is pretty much as fast as this camera can take pics. My camera doesn’t have burst mode so I don’t have experience with taking photos that quickly. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: a guy

customer_reviews.title: Be CAREFUL to remove onboard software (format immediately)
customer_reviews.text: While I have no doubt this is a genuine Sandisk memory card, mine definately contained a tiny "program" (to communicate with the mother ship?); I have not seen this in the past on this particular item; it immediately changed my network connection non-destructively, which was remedied by a quick fresh erase and format. I really do not appreciate any vendor of electronics having unexpected software on board. Giving 4 stars only because I know the card itself is good.
customer_reviews.author: P. Tuggle

customer_reviews.title: Freezes and Lags on DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this 32gb to back up my 32gb Transcend on my Nikon D800 full frame... I honestly regret the purchase. It Lags and freezes far worst than the 16gb Sandisk in the middle which I use on my Nikon D3300. While working on a wedding shoot, I had to decide switching it out because it was causing too much delay between shoots, I was afraid it would malfunction on me and lose all my files... Sticking with my 32gb Transcend; smooth and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Slick

customer_reviews.title: Memory Card
customer_reviews.text: It arrived with the exterior package in perfect condition. So there is no reason for the condition of the item itself. The cardboard sheet had been wet and had water lines. The plastic portion that contained the card, was bent and twisted a bit. I was afraid that it wouldn't work. But, after putting it in my camera, it seems to be okay. Although this had not been used, it looked like it had been in someones garage for a few years unopened.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly D

customer_reviews.title: Music Music Music!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to add iTunes music for my VW SD slot. I don’t always want to use CarPlay or Bluetooth, yet still wanted to listen to my iTunes library while driving with the same ease of use as the radio or CD. I was able to drag and drop my iTunes library to this SD card on my Mac, and then plug and play the music in my VW. No fuss, no tricky file conversion. If you want this for music in a car that supports SD, this is your product!
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: did not work in my camera
customer_reviews.text: I discovered after receiving this item that for some of the older model cameras can't format this size card. It wasn't until i returned the item & talked to the sales clerk at Target that I found this out. It might be good to list that info somewhere in the details so that buyers are aware. I would have ordered the smaller card if I'd known. The price was good & typically that particular brand card is great.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Ritz

customer_reviews.title: Normally SanDisk is my standby, but I got a defective card
customer_reviews.text: Having some issues, and I’m not sure if it’s the camera or a faulty card. But despite formatting and all that, my Sony camcorder is now recording video to the card in 10-minute ‘pieces’. However when I use internal memory, this issue is non-existent. So I’m thinking I got a faulty card, however this issue popped up recently and I’m pretty sure I’m outside the return timeframe. Only time I’ve ever had an issue with SanDisk, so I’m sure this is an isolated incident.
customer_reviews.author: B.T. Frank

customer_reviews.title: Total headache
customer_reviews.text: I expected this to be like every other memory card I have gotten in the past. Basically you just put it in and go, but not this one. You have to format it. I had no idea how to do that so had to google it and spend a ton of time just trying to make it useable. In all honestly I haven't even got it formatted yet so it is still sitting on my desk. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Amazon buyer

customer_reviews.title: This works on the Wii U
customer_reviews.text: I'm only using this in a Wii U. I haven't not used it on in a computer or camera. As for the Wii U, it only works for the original Wii games played on the Wii U console through the Wii app. You can not save Wii U game data to it. I'm just happy that I was able to find a good card that works on that old console.
customer_reviews.author: VG Wisconsin

customer_reviews.title: The other two work great.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased three of these for my trail cameras. My computers say there is an error with one of them. Nothing more frustrating than finding out a week of footage isn't able to be read. I have tried using it in other devices with the same result. Unfortunately, I discarded the packaging so I can no longer return the defective one. The other two work great.
customer_reviews.author: D. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: I've Had 3 SanDisk Ultras that failed
customer_reviews.text: I take a lot of pictures ... I don't typically erase my pics from the SD Cards and reuse the cards so I'm at a loss to figure out why three of my SanDisk Ultras (2-32gb and 1-16gb) failed. I had to use a recovery software program to pull my pics from the SD cards. I have other SanDisks and Sonys that are fine ... any ideas? One is a fluke ... two is the beginning of a mystery ... three means either I'm doing something wrong or the SD cards don't like my camera or computer.
customer_reviews.author: peaceloveandal

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this SD card when I bought a digital camera that records in HD and have been using both in conjunction for about 2 years now. I have not had any problems with this SD card whatsoever. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: beli8

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Memory Card for Filming HD Video with a DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this along with my Canon 100D DSLR. SanDisk Ultra is the perfect speed memory card to ensure my videos don't have any framerate problems. For stills only, you can save a few cents by going with the regular SanDisk memory card (the blue one), but this is a must if you are filming HD video.
customer_reviews.author: Buying_the_Internet

customer_reviews.title: Just the best memory card out there
customer_reviews.text: It's nice to buy something that is reasonably priced and very reliable. With Scandisk memory cards you know what you're getting and can count on them to work. I also like that while they are very securely packaged to make sure they survive the trip they are NOT over packaged. You don't get plastic inside plastic inside more plastic. Like a Scandisk card itself the packaging is reasonable and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hilborn

customer_reviews.title: Rip CD's for Jeep playback
customer_reviews.text: The Jeep Grand Cherokee I recently purchased doesn't have a CD player. Used this SD drive along with LG external DVD drive to rip my CD's. Worked perfectly and I'm actually happier with playback as there's minimal delay in changing CD and the contents are displayed on-screen, where I used to have to remember which CD was at which number in the mult-disk player. Also less stuff floating around and CD's are safely back in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Milsma

customer_reviews.title: DOES WHAT IT IS MEANT TO DO
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to use in my new camcorder. Very few electronics come with the cards needed these days. It works great. pictures and video are great quality as you can see by my pictures. I was very thankful to find this on sale here.
customer_reviews.author: timeforachange

customer_reviews.title: Great SD card for video and photography.
customer_reviews.text: This 32GB SD card work great for recording HD videos and taking high-quality photos. It does not look counterfeit and it works perfect. Just make sure you format the SD card before using it in a camera, just in case. 32GB is the perfect size to get as a beginner photographer/videographer. I do not suggest getting an SD card bigger than 64GB because if you store all of your stuff on there and the card breaks, you basically have no chance of getting any of the things back. That is why it is better to have multiple smaller size SD cards then 1 big one.
customer_reviews.author: Prokop

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Reliable  Perfect
customer_reviews.text: OK , Its A Memory Card , plug it into the trail camera , format and it works Uno Momento !!!! , Then have it record whatever is decimating my bird feeders, remove the card and lose it . Search the entire house for 2 days , look in places that it would never be, blame everyone else....... 5 Days later , after 5 inches of rain , being driven over , withstand leaf blowers located in driveway and inserted back into camera Its Worked !!! And Deer Suck !
customer_reviews.author: R.J. Dell

customer_reviews.title: Bad Disk
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this Nov of 2017 and kept it in the package until I needed it for my camera. I took pics and video only to find out it was a bad disc and I am unable to retrieve the pictures off the card. I have never had trouble with any ScanDisk that I have purchased, and I use a lot of them. I am not blaming the seller or the mfg as this stuff happens as it is impossible for everything to work perfectly when it comes to electronics and memory readers etc. I was asked for a review and this is mine..
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Class 10 is Fast with Sony Camera
customer_reviews.text: I use these on a Sony DSC-HX350 (300 or 400) Camera. And they are very fast at storing the images. With still shots maybe a second and it's ready to shoot again. Even burst mode doesn't take too long to save. Maybe 20 seconds? Important note: I have my camera set to NOT DISPLAY the photo it just took. So it is always immediately ready after it saves for the next shot. Find that in the settings menu. I figure I can look later, not during the birds flying time.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Krehbiel

customer_reviews.title: Need a large capacity SD card for your device?
customer_reviews.text: The Good: -Large capacity -Fast response time for cameras -Fits any device that takes SD card -Good value The Bad: -None The Bottom Line: I’m using this SD card in my Canon Powershot SX740 and it’s been great. The SD card has fast response time so it handles picture taking well. It is large capacity so even with 20 megapixels I can fit a lot of pictures. Overall I would recommend this SD card especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Hoppaguy

customer_reviews.title: Worthless possible fake card with slow speed.
customer_reviews.text: I received a what I think is a fake Sandisk card. The majority of use that I have used it for was photography so speed wasn't a big issue until I recently purchased a 1080p Canon Vixia video camera then I started having buffer overrun isssues. On a whim I decided to speed test it. I am not even getting 15MB/s with it. Ugggh, speed test your card when you get it to make sure you didn't get a cheap Chinese fake like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Keith K.

customer_reviews.title: I have purchased several of these....
customer_reviews.text: This has primarily used in my daughter’s Nikon DSLR 3400, my Nikon DSLR 5400, and both of my kids fire tablets. We have run into no issues with the card whatsoever! I love the price point of these on Amazon. This is probably the 6th one that I have purchased on here, and have never run into an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn

customer_reviews.title: Side lock on the card slips into the locked position
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two - on one, the lock on the side of the memory card will not stay in the unlocked position. It's an inconvenience when trying to load in your camera for normal shooting but a major issue when changing fast for a commercial shoot. I taped the lock and moved on ... probably slipped thru quality control but it is an issue. Otherwise the product works as described.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for use in trail cameras, and...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these memory cards to use in my trail cameras. They are more than fast enough for 1080p hd video. They come in retail packaging assuring authenticity. And, the price is very good too, so I purchased an extra... I use my trail cameras in time-lapse mode; one image every 15 minutes. I document my outside hydroponic setup using it. I can let my camera run unattended for several weeks using these 32gb cards. Overall, I was happy with my purchase...
customer_reviews.author: ChuckleHead

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected and that's all I can ask of ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected and that's all I can ask of it. It's not incredibly fast, but no SD cards are. Used it for my 2DS for homebrew if anyone is curious if it will work with that, then I can confirm it will indeed work on both non-homebrew and homebrew-activated 2/3DS's.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great card and storage, be aware of SD type differences
customer_reviews.text: I needed an SD card for my new camera, I thought I had ordered this as a microSDXC card, but it was a full size SD card. Even still, I was able to use it to transfer photos and videos between another device and computers that use this style and size. If it's what you need for your device, it does work well. Make sure you get the right type before you order!
customer_reviews.author: James W

customer_reviews.title: Repeat Formatting Error, Lost Many Photos
customer_reviews.text: I am a loyal SanDisk user, but this is my first time trying the Ultra version of the card. It seems as there must have been a bad batch. Every two or three uses, you get an error message when trying to take the photos off of the camera that you need to reformat the SD card. If you reformat, you lose all of the photos. I sacrificed some the first time and reformatted, thinking it was a one time error. I very stupidly used the same card again, worked fine a few times, and just had the same error on a batch of important photos. So so so disappointed in this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: UIdaho GSSP

customer_reviews.title: SUPER RELIABLE MEDIA
customer_reviews.text: SanDisk is the gold standard I've depended on for years. I use these cards in my DSLR and also in my Zoom digital audio recorder when on location. I've never had one fail, ever. On set and on location I need to not have to worry about my recording media, and I never have to worry when I'm using SanDisk. I'm moving into equipment that uses SSD cards for storage, and I'm going to stick with SanDisk for that media as well.
customer_reviews.author: KWJTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Quality cards for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: SDXC cards are needed for recording in Sony's XAVCS codec. These get the job done, and 64 GB is plenty for me. I have a total of 4 of these particular cards and love the read write speeds. I did have one of these cards fail on me however, so i knocked off a star for that. Cant complain to much though because it was mounted in a GOPRO camera
customer_reviews.author: Naled IT Media

customer_reviews.title: Gets "Lost"
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why, but in trying to upload/download pictures and videos, the computer keeps saying to "Please insert a disk into SDHC (E:)- while its already inserted. I have to restart the computer and it "finds" it again and am able to load it with pictures and videos. Shortly, it will say that again. Two different networks both running well, 1 at 250 mbps and the other at 68 mbps. I wouldn't recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany R.

customer_reviews.title: Great for storing files while on the road. Love the ease of use with these memory cards
customer_reviews.text: Between my radio show and television show I have a lot of files that I'm dealing with from week to week. I got these cards to make transferring those files from my camera and cellphone to my laptop easier---and it does the job. They are ready to use right out of the package, and I can easily drag the files I need where I need them. Lots of space at a great price. That makes these 16GB cards perfect for my work.
customer_reviews.author: Cyrus Webb

customer_reviews.title: Stupidty
customer_reviews.text: I got an email saying I didn’t return the sands but if they look inside of the camera it was in it. The fact that the one who took the first order for the return didn’t fill out the paperwork correctly and listed the sands twice isn’t my fault as he didn’t even mention the camera or camera case and they did return the payment for that. There was only the one sandisk and like I said I left it in the camera but if you think you have to charge me for another one that will be fine as I can take my business elsewhere from now on. Sincerely, Milford
customer_reviews.author: Budworthy

customer_reviews.title: Did not work!
customer_reviews.text: We were planning to use this card to film our school's musical. We had borrowed a video camera from our school's video department in communication services. We opened the package and put this card straight into the video camera to test it out, and THE CARD DOES NOT WORK. We called the person who we borrowed the camera from, who does this for a living. He came to check it out, and said it is the correct type of card to use, but that SOMETHING IS WRONG WITH THE CARD! He went and got a different card and brought it to us, and that one worked perfectly. So this one can't even be used. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel L

customer_reviews.title: It was a quick fix
customer_reviews.text: I was modifying a friend's Wii and needed a decent SD card for him to keep, so I got this, and I haven't had any complaints. It worked great when i was setting everything up, and I haven't heard anything back. Could you probably find a better deal? yeah. Regardless, this was a good enough deal, it was convenient, and it's a brand I have some amount of faith in.
customer_reviews.author: Spooty J.

customer_reviews.title: Improved Speed/Inexpensive Price
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing to me how much better technology is getting. I had been using an old SD card for years and it worked fine. I transfer photos from my SLR camera to my MACBook Pro 3-4 times a weeks, so I used it a lot. When I replaced the old SD card with this one, I not only got additional GB (going from 8 to 32), but I paid a pittance for the new card and EVERYTHING performs much faster on the new SD card. File transfer, ejecting the card, reading the card, etc. I couldn't have been more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph R. Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Samsung's card is definetely faster
customer_reviews.text: This card is really slow compared to Samsung's EVO Plus (64GB and 128GB). I use it on a Nikon D5300 (as it is recommended for it) and it takes forever to write the raw to the card. If I continous shooting it will take 1s for each picture (at least 5s to write everything to it). I changed to Samsung EVO and the buffer time is close to writing speeds I got with it. It will also take the double of the time to copy the photos you have to lightroom. Just go with Samsung's SD cards.
customer_reviews.author: Emanuel Alves

customer_reviews.title: Got a bad SD card.
customer_reviews.text: Well...went out did a photo shoot and viewed the pictures on my camera ... got home and inserted SD into computer and all of it was gone! Seems like i got a bad card. I did recover a few with a program. But not all. Kinda nervous to try another card out . I’m tossing this one but I have two more in their packages still. Not sure I should give them a try.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: GOOD!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my Sony S Tablet to transfer my e-books to for reading. It fills up fast! But, it does a great job for me! Since my tablet only allows 32GB SDHC cards, I have had to just buy these on sale for each category I have: e-books, music, movies, recipes, etc.. I AM VERY SATISFIED. You can never go wrong with SANDISK!
customer_reviews.author: SayWhat

customer_reviews.title: Good value. Only 40 MB/s transfer speed on reads
customer_reviews.text: These are a great price and I like the SanDisk brand. They got the job done. The only CON is that the 80 MB/S does not apply in reading, or writing. I transferred images and video through a USB 3 port and the highest transfer rate I observed was 40 MB/S. Not sure if the USB SD card reader is to blame. But I’d like to hear other people’s experience with transfer speed. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: 80Mb/s is not a lie
customer_reviews.text: I did test the speed of transfer of 1GB/s with some video files from this card using a USB3 adapter onto my 970 Pro SSD drive (very fast hard drive to not be a bottleneck). I got a max transfer speed of 80.1 Mb/s and an average speed of about 77Mbps. I do consider it close enough to consider this card a very good card. Of course, you can now get much faster using other media types but it is fast enough for my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Henri Savin

customer_reviews.title: Max Density for Browning Trail Cam
customer_reviews.text: I use these cards in my Browning Trail cameras as the max they support is 32GB. I mostly use them for still pictures of the wildlife on my ranch. Using a card that supports the maximum density the camera will support is important as sometimes it can be a month or more til i'm able to swap out the cards. I'm finding standard SD cards are more reliable than MicroSD cards in SD Adapters. This card holds all the pictures until I am able to pull the cards and review the pictures. I will be ordering more as I add more cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: 35mm photography requires a lot of data storage and at only $7.93 for 32 GB this is an answer to a need. USB 3 makes it fast enough for video and super fast to upload to your laptop. It's a SanDisk so no worries about quality. I keep a few around for backup in case one should fail, which disks always do from multiple insertions. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: TonyT in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Great Game cam card!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card for my husband who needed an extra card for his game cam. Wow, were we impressed. The still pics, video and night scenes were captured beautifully. It is holding up well in the cam even in our current weather extremes. I been a fan of Sandisk products for a long time and this card did not let me down. For the quality and the price it is hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: ArKay61

customer_reviews.title: Great card, will never buy any other brand.
customer_reviews.text: I will never buy anything but SanDisk SD cards, I have had many other brands over the years fail out of no where, SanDisk is the only one that actually cared about the product to replace it. And it has a lifetime warranty, that right there is worth the little extra cost over other brands. I have used the warranty once on an older Micro SD card and I mailed it out and a few days later I had a brand new card mailed back to me, not really a big hassle.
customer_reviews.author: rustyk123

customer_reviews.title: Good card - quality product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this SanDisk card for use in a digital SLR and was looking for good speed and image quality. The card does a great job for casual photography and holds a great many photos at high resolution, it is not the best for burst shooting though since it takes a little longer to record the image than some of the faster cards I’ve used in the past. Depending on your needs this may be excellent for you or you may want to go with something faster if you are looking for super quick writing time on the card.
customer_reviews.author: Elinor Johnson

product_meta.title: SanDisk Ultra 64GB Class 10 SDXC UHS-I Memory Card up to 80MB/s (SDSDUNC-064G-GN6IN)
product_meta.description: Capacity:64GBTwice as fast as ordinary SDHC and SDXC cards to take better pictures and Full HD videos with your compact to mid-range point and shoot cameras and camcorders. With SanDisk Ultra UHS-I cards you'll benefit from faster downloads, high capacity, and better performance to capture and store high quality pictures and Full HD video. Take advantage of ultra-fast read speeds of up to 80MB/s to save time moving photos and videos from the card to your computer. SanDisk Ultra UHS-I cards are water proof, temperature proof, X-ray proof, shock proof, compatible with SDHC and SDXC digital devices, and come with a 10-year limited warranty.
feature_bullets: Great for Compact to midrange Point and Shoot digital Cameras and camcorders
Twice As Fast As Ordinary SDHC Cards, Allowing You To Take Pictures And Transfer Files Quickly
Exceptional video recording performance with class 10 rating for Full HD video (1080p); Compatibility : SDHC I/SDXC I devices
Quick transfer speeds up to 80MB/s and WaterProof, temperature Proof, X ray Proof, magnet Proof, shockProof

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars50,932 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
